abstract: With all that’s been written about Groupon, one question lingers: Are the local businesses that use it eager to use it again?
snippet: With all that’s been written about Groupon, one question lingers: Are the local businesses that use it eager to use it again?
lead_paragraph: As you may have noticed, we’ve been writing about Groupon a lot lately. MP Mueller did a post on the experiences of a high-end restaurant in Austin, Tex., and offered some tips. I suggested how you might do the math to assess your Groupon deal (and a smart reader pointed out that I did not fully account for the loss of revenue if your regular customers buy Groupon coupons). In fact, we got lots of smart comments (especially here and here). We also ran several articles when it looked as if Google was going to buy Groupon and another reporting that the founders and owners of Groupon had decided to turn down Google’s $6 billion offer.

headline.main: Would Your Business Use Groupon Again?
